title: ex hollyoaks star andy newton lee disqualified from hull marathon for wearing headphones
story: Andy Newton-Lee, who has also appeared in Coronation Street and Doctors, was one of three runners whose final times did not count.He has since hit out at the organisers, saying the decision was cruel and not in the spirit of the community here in Hull.Andy claimed a volunteer screamed hes got headphones in, disqualy him in the 23rd mile of the race.But he did not receive the heartbreaking news until after he had already finished in a time of four hours, 14 minutes, 11 seconds.He took to Instagram to say: I am saddened and disappointed to share that I have been officially disqualied.I am yet know or understand why myself and two other kind-spirited runners have been treated in such a cruel way.This is not only cruel but not in the spirit of the community here in Hull.Would my result become official I was placed 345 out of 627 runners.Race organisers claimed headphones were banned for safety reasons.They also said they made this rule clear before the race and in the announcements as runners lined up to start.But it was of little consolation to Andy who has done marathons in New York, Los Angeles and Sydney in the past.He told Hull Live: I did not do any training for it but am quite physically fit.I am not saying I am above the rules, and  the rule is no headphones then fair enough.But I do not think the way I was treated was in the spirit of the marathon.A spokesman for the marathon said the headphone rule was a UK rule.

title: judi dench kevin spacey defends friends
story: The Bond actress, 83, slammed directors who cut the House of Cards star out of movies and described him as a good friend.Judi starred alongside Kevin, 59, in 2001s The Shipping News and said he was a rock after he husbands death the same yearSpeaking at the San Sebastian International Film Festival, the actress said: Kevin was an inestimable comfort and never mentioned he knew I was in a bad way.He cheered me up and kept me going.Variety report that she also took aim at directors who snipped him out of movies a after deluge of worrying claims.Last year, Spacey was cut out of All The Money In The World, and his scenes re-shot with Christopher Plummer.Judi added: I can’t approve, in any way, of the fact that — whatever he has done — that you then start to cut him out of the films.Are we to do what happened when he was replaced with Christopher Plummer? Are we to do that throughout history?Dressed in a black dress, with glistening diamond jewellery , Dame Judi received the festival prestigious Donostia Award for her letime of work.Spacey was stripped of an International Emmy Award and his acclaimed Netflix series House of Cards was axed after a string of men accused him of sexual misconduct.

title: passenger goair india open plane door toilet
story: The man, in his late 20s, was travelling on a GoAir flight from New Delhi to Patna in India on Saturday when he urgently needed the bathroom.Local media reported that passengers were screaming while cabin crew wrestled the man away from the door and ordered him to remain in his seat for the rest of his flight.He was was escorted from the plane by airport security upon arrival and handed over to police, who quizzed him about his motives and he admitted it was a mistake.Sanowar Khan, the officer in charge of the local police, said the man caused pandemonium when he tried to open the rear door.Khan told Kolkata-based newspaper The : “People asked him why he was doing so .He told them that he needed to use the washroom urgently and kept tugging at the exit door.Pandemonium prevailed amid all this and he was restrained and finally handed over to us.He said that the confusion happened because he had boarded a flight for the first time in his le.”Khan added that the man, who is a banker and was flying for the first time, was released without charge.He said: There was no ulterior motive behind this act.A GoAir spokesperson said the 1hr 45min flight, which was carrying 150 passengers, landed safely in Patna at 7.35pm on Saturday.They said: “A passenger on flight G8 149 Del-Pat was trying to open the rear door of the aircraft while in the air.“A co-passenger raised the alarm and he was intercepted by the crew. Post arrival, the passenger was handed over to CISF  for further investigation.”The security force, which is part of the Indian military, told the Times of India the man had managed to unlock the rear door but couldnt open it due to cabin pressure.

title: britains kids weaker than ever
story: The rate of decline in muscle endurance was 2½ per cent a year in the decade before 2008, but has been four per cent each year since.And the rate of decrease in strength accelerated from 0.6 per cent a year to 1.6 per cent.Experts urged action to improve children’s fitness, not just weight.Essex University’s Dr Gavin Sandercock said: “As ten-year-olds are taller and heavier than those measured be­fore, we thought they would be stronger and more powerful.But they’re weaker.“Since 1998 strength is down 20 per cent and endurance 30 per cent.More concerning is that rate of decline is accelerating.It suggests kids are doing less exercise.”The findings of his 4,800-child study in Chelmsford, Essex, came despite a six per cent obesity level and BMI — a height-weight ratio — that had both barely changed.He said: “Four in five had normal BMIs.“But one in three of normal weight were unfit.We found that overweight but not obese children were strongest, fittest and healthiest.” Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: brussels eu press regulation sun
story: Justice commissioner Vera Jourova was riled by our front page labelling EU leaders “dirty rats” over their tactics.She accused the UK media of spreading “disinformation” and suggested “smart regulation”.Speaking in Austria, Ms Jourova said: “Media can build the culture of dialogue or sow isions, spread disinformation and encourage exclusion.“The Brexit debate is the best example of that. Do you remember the front page of a popular British daily calling the judges the ‘enemy of the people’?Or just last week, the EU leaders were called ‘dirty rats’ on another front page.Almost daily we could find examples of stories that are spiced up to point out the enemy, to paint the picture black and white.I would advocate for a European approach to media based on quality and smart regulation,  needed.But Tory MEP Amjad Bashir said: “Commissioners should not be trying to shackle the Press.“We politicians do not always like what journalists write, but they have to be free to report the news as they see it.The vibrancy and iety of our newspapers is one of the things that makes Britain great.People have to learn to take the rough with the smooth.Otherwise we are on a slippery slope to state control and oppression.Mr Bashir’s colleague Ashley Fox added: “A free and unfettered media is vital.” EU officials insisted there was no new legislative action in the pipeline in terms of media regulation and that Ms Jourova had been talking about broadcasters.A Commission spokeswoman said she was merely trying to “trigger a discussion”.Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: dementia cheerleading health memory fitness
story: Women in care homes, nursing homes, dementia groups and assisted living centres are all getting on board with the tassel trend.The classes, run by Tina Blackwill, encourage those who are less physically mobile to punch the air, lt their knees, move their arms and legs and include some shimmies.Tina, who rocks up to the homes with glitter on her face and tassels on her clothing, gives all of those in her classes sparkly pom poms to perform with.She said: “We use older tunes with a modern twist and I just love seeing the smiles on their little faces when I walk in.“It is a great for memory, coordination, suppleness, general wellbeing and most importantly fun!“It is proven that exercise helps dementia and improves quality of le for those older people who are living in care homes. Everyone is encouraged to just do what they can, but everyone really loves it and its one of the highlights of my days.“They love the classes and the people at the nursing homes and clubs say it brightens up their days and it really helps them to feel better in themselves.“Some of them even say that they feel years younger after the classes, and it’s the most alive they’ve seen them in years.”Tina travels across many care homes in Bristol a week to engage women of all abilities in her pom pom exercise class. Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: michael douglas president catherine zeta jones
story: The couple, who turned 74 and 49 respectively, have been married for nearly 18 years.Jones took to Instagram last night to wish Douglas a happy birthday, calling him my very own President.The Welsh actress added clips from her husbands 1995 flick The American President in which he plays the US leader.She wrote: Happy Birthday to my very own President! My husband Michael.I guess that makes me First Lady! Stranger things have happened! Go figure.Oops, its my birthday today too.Douglas has worked for the UN for years, serving as a United Nations Messenger of Peace since 1998 and is the longest serving holder of the position.He has been a long-time supporter of the Democratic Party and a vocal advocate of gun control and nuclear non-proleration.Despite his contrary political views to the current occupant of The White House he has in the past described Donald Trump as a friend.While Trump was running in 2016 the Wall Street star said of the then candidate: I know him personally and hes a charming guy - I play golf with him and he’s got a very good self-effacing sense of humour.I dont agree with him politically but I think hes set a tone thats attracted a certain set of our population, Im just not sure how much its going to grow before the election.However he added: Im a Democrat by le, I know the Clintons pretty well, Bill when he was in office and Hillary Clinton, I think shell be a spectacular President.Meanwhile, Trumps speech at the UN yesterday drew laughter from world leaders as the US President boasted of his “extraordinary” achievements.Praising Americas booming economy, the brash billionaire said: My administration has accomplished more in two years than almost any administration in the history of our country... so true.Seemingly taken aback by his boast, the audience broke into laughter, prompting a smiling Trump to say: “I wasnt expecting that reaction but thats OK.

title: jeremy corbyn shuns traditional dawn media round ahead of big conference speech today as hes not good in the morning
story: Sources suggested broadcasters had been told the 69 year-old Labour leader would not be speaking to them as he gears up to deliver his address to conference in Liverpool.One insider told The Sun: “Labour are saying Jeremy’s ‘not good in the morning’. Presumably he’ll fix it  he gets into Number 10.”BBC Radio 4 Today host Nick Robinson said on air yesterday he was still waiting to hear  the Labour leader would be available today.A separate source said they had been told Rebecca Long Bailey was the only Shadow Minister who would be available this morning from conference.Labour insiders described the row as “nonsense” but declined to comment.Mr Corbyn did a series of interviews with TV channels yesterday ahead of today’s crunch appearance, and told ITV that “nothing keeps me awake at night”.Asked how long he would be in charge of the party given his age, he said: Im very healthy, very fit, very proud to lead our party.“I will carry on doing exactly that because I want to bring about a social transformation and give real hope to young people and those who are up against it in our society.Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: royal mail walkers crisp packets
story: Baffled postal workers keep finding the litter in letterboxes without envelopes addressed to Walkers freepost address.It turns out that eco-warriors have been sending the bags back to the crisp makers as a protest against its use of non-recyclable packets.A campaign on the petition website 38 Degrees called on Leicestershire-based Walkers to ditch plastic packaging.It reads: We call upon Walkers and other manufacturers to change the materials for their packets to one which is recyclable or even more preferably a non-plastic environmentally friendly material.The petition was later bolstered by a separate post on the site titled #PacketInWalkers - Post your plastic packet back to Walkers.It called on the hundreds of thousands of campaign backers to join in a cunning plan to make the crisp giant pay attention to their environmentally friendly cause.But Royal Mail are begging people to stop posting the packets without an envelope because they are causing delays.A spokesperson told the BBC: We strongly encourage customers not to post anything in the postal system which is not properly packaged.Crisp packets cant go through the machines, they are not normal mail items therefore my hardworking colleagues need to manually sort them, which adds to time.But green activists have taken to social media using the campaign hashtag to tell Walkers to change its ways, even though it has previously committed to using compostable or biodegradable packaging by 2025.The 38 Degrees Twitter account posted: By the time @walkers_crisps goes plastic free in 2025 theyll have produced 28 billion more bags of crisps.310,000 think this isnt good enough - so 38 Degrees members are posting their crisp packets back to Walkers. #PacketInWalkers.Walkers have confirmed that they have received some of the ed packets and will use them for research.A spokesperson said: We recognise the efforts being made to bring the issue of packaging waste to our attention.

title: mh370 plane is in a thousand pieces at the bottom of the indian ocean in an unexplored zone new documentary claims
story: The Malaysian Airlines plane disappeared without a trace on March 2014 on a flight from Kuala Lumpor to Beijing, killing all 239 people on board.National Geographic’s Drain the Oceans series has now, with the help of experts, pinned what it thinks is the jets likely location and what the wreckage would look like on the ocean floor.The programme says the plane is located at around 35 degrees south on a line known as the seventh arc, in reference to the last time MH370 sent a satellite message.Using computer graphics it has “drained” the area around the seventh arc to reveal what the wreckage of the aircraft could look like.The debris will stretch over thousands of yards, it says, and while the engines will be in one piece, the fuselage will be in thousands.Drain the Oceans says blackboxes will reveal  anyone was in the cockpit at the end and oxygen cylinders will show  the plane was deliberately depressurised in flightPersonal electronic devices could reveal the experiences and fate of inidual passengers and crew.Andy Sherrell, an undersea search specialist who has taken part in the hunt for MH370 and found the wrecks of other aircraft underwater, says the moment it is found will be “sombre”.“It’s a really surreal sombre moment because you realise all of a sudden you’ve found this grave site, this place where all these people persished,” Sherrell told the programme.“It’s sad but it’s also a bit of a relief because you know from that point forward some answers are going to come back.”The exact location was arrived at by oceanographer David Grfin using wreckage found thousands of miles away.He believes the flapperon which was found on the French island of Reunion holds the key to finding the location of MH370.Dr Grfin conducted an experiment using an identical flapperon off a Boeing 777 and using data about currents in the Indian Ocean was able to map its 500 day journey across the sea.He was also curious about why no debris had been washed up in Australia when currents in the area where the plane crashed flow towards the country.The scientist was able to rule out areas on the seventh arc where the current flows towards Australia as a possible crash site.Dr Grfin looked at the data for the currents that exists for the day MH370 crashed and pinpointed where on the seventh arc currents would have pushed debris away from Australia towards Africa.Only one of the locations on the seventh arc matched his calculation of the flapperon’s journey – 35 degrees south.The area was not checked during the initial surface search for the wreckage of the plane.His view that MH370 crashed there was backed by images from a French military satellite taken 15 days after the plane’s disappearance showing possible debris on the surface in the 35 south area.“I remember the day when I first saw those images in high resolution and I thought ‘oh my God’,” he said.Beginning in January this year a search was mounted in that area by a privately funded expedition run by salvage company Ocean Infinity.But despite searching an enormous area, the expedition found no trace of MH370.The search has now covered an area 14 times that scoured in the hunt for Air France flight 447, which crashed in the South Atlantic and took two years to find.In May the Malaysian government called off the search for MH370 but Drain the Oceans says it could lie tantalisingly close to the search area.“I think it’s enormously important to find the plane because while planes crash routinely they don’t just disappear and I think this just terries people,” says David Grfin.• Drain The Oceans: Malaysia  Airlines  370 airs on National Geographic this Thursday, 27 September at 8pm.

title: beluga whale spotted in river thames resurfaces near gravesend in kent
story: After its arrival yesterday, the Beluga disappeared for around 12 hours but has now resurfaced at the Gravesend side of the estuary, a relief to onlookers hoping to catch a sighting of the whale.Birding expert Dave Andrews first saw the white whale, which an expert has confirmed to be a Beluga, at 11am yesterday near Gravesend, Kent.The whale was last seen yesterday at Tilbury Docks on the River Thames, 30 miles from the sea.But at 8.30pm yesterday it disappeared, sparking fears that the Beluga, who is thought to have been forced from its home by storms, might have died.It reappeared this morning at 11.30m back in its original spot in Gravesend, where it was first seen, causing a sigh of relief from conservationists and spotters.Tweets began appearing at 9.30am today to confirm the whale has resurfaced in Gravesend.It has been popping to the surface, visible due to its ghostly white colour, every couple of minutes.A patrol boat is motoring its movements.Conservationists are now concerned that the Beluga whale could be very lost  it doesnt  to the sea.There are also concerns the Beluga might eat a plastic bag, due to the large numbers of them in the Thames, according to Tanya Ferry, environment manager at the Port of London Authority.RSPCA’s Acting Chief Inspector Clair Dew said they would be keeping a close watch on the whale’s progress, but there were no plans to mount a rescue mission or encourage it out to sea.After first seeing the whale, Andrews tweeted: Cant believe Im writing this, no joke - BELUGA in the Thames off Coalhouse Fort.He claimed the whale remained in the same spot for hours feeding around the barges in the river.Marine experts told the BBC it is almost certainly a Beluga whale and urged the public to watch it from the shore.Lucy Babey from ORCA said: This is the most southerly sighting of a beluga we have ever seen around these shores.Belugas can weigh up to 1,400kg and measure more than four metres long.Sightings of Beluga whales are extremely rare on the coasts of the UK and normally only occur off the coast of Scotland, as this is closest to their native waters.Beluga whales usually travel in groups or pods and a sighting of a solo whale could indicate it has got lost, or is disorientated.After Andrews tweeted the exact location, there was an influx of people arriving at the scene to view the whale for themselves.Lucy from ORCA told The Sun: We want to urge people not to disturb the animal. Its out of range and probably distressed.People rushing to the site in boats or with drones will only disturb the whale and cause it more distress.If you wish to see the whale for yourself, stay on the shore and do not get in the water.The last time a whale was spotted in the River Thames was a bottlenose whale, now known as the River Thames Whale.In January 2006 a female northern bottlenose whale swam up the Thames and caused hysteria in London.She sadly died during a rescue mission near Battersea.A spokesperson for Whale and Dolphin Conservation said: Belugas are High Arctic species and this one is thousands of miles from where it should be! Belugas are usually associated close to the ice in places like Greenland, Svalbard or the Barents Sea.He or she is obviously very lost and quite possibly in trouble. There are a few reports of belugas in the UK in recent years.In the summer of 2015 two were spotted off the Northumberland coast and one in Northern Ireland. We would urge that the whale is given space and disturbance is kept to a minimum.

title: every worker in britain should go on strike to force the tories out mp demands
story: Laura Smith, the Labour MP for Crewe and Nantwich, called for a general strike  there isnt a general election that they can try and storm into No10.Speaking at Momentums The World Transformed shadow festival in Liverpool last night, she stormed: Today weve heard calls for a true peoples vote, a general election.We must topple this cruel and callous government as soon as we can.And  we cant get a general election, We should organise with our brothers and sisters to bring an end to this government with a general strike.The crowd went wild for a call, giving her a standing ovation and delighted cheers.The last general strike was in 1926 over wages for coal miners - and 1.7million people took part.Labours shadow justice secretary Richard Burgon applauded her call - along with fellow MP Chris Williamson.But despite the video footage he denied he gave her a standing ovation, and said he didnt support a general strike.He told TalkRadio: I applauded a fantastic speech by Laura Smith who a year ago was a single mother wondering what she could do to help secure a Labour government that would help her community.After a warm reception from the audience, Ms Smith added: That went better than I thought it could have gone!Labour are fighting for another election to try and take power - but this morning Labour figures sought to distance themselves from the call for a strike.Deputy leader Tom Watson slapped her down, and said it wasnt a helpful thing to say.He told BBC Radio 4s Today programme: Well, its not particularly helpful, but she is a new MP and she was at a big fringe event - nothing to do with the party organisation - and Im sure she got a little bit carried away.And business secretary Rebecca Long-Bailey said it was not Labour party policy.Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: iphone grave stone russia
story: Mourners in the oil-rich city of Ufa were amazed to see the huge tombstone erected over Rita Shameeva’s burial plot.It is made from black basalt and bears the Apple symbol on the reverse, and a picture of Shameeva on the front.It was erected by her grieving dad Rais Shameev two years after her death in January 2016 from an unknown cause, say reports.He has not commented on the unusual memorial.The five-foot high monument towers above other gravestones in the Yuzhnoye cemetery, and also has a QR code on the base.Local headstone maker Ilgam Galliulin denied he was responsible for its design.He said: “My father and I make monuments to order.“But I saw this unusual one for the first time last week.”Mourner Nikolay Yevdokimov told to newspaper ProUral: “I thought I was having hallucinations.“How could an American smartphone suddenly appear at our cemetery?“And such a huge one.“I came closer and was surprised.“Ive seen many gravestones, but to make one in the form of [an] iPhone - this is the first time, to be honest.Little is known of Rita except that she was a keen traveller and had friends in Germany.She also loved her smartphone.The grave is believed to have been commissioned from a Siberian company which offers “death accessories”.Designer Pavel Kalyuk built a similar headstone as an advertising gimmick.He said: We began to make monuments just to attract attention.But after exhibiting his work at a funeral exhibition in Novosibirsk, orders came in for the bizarre tombstones.

title: emma dent coad royal family charity work
story: Emma Dent Coad said the royal family’s support for charity is only “peripheral” and claimed volunteers do “99 per cent of the work”.She has previously claimed Prince Harry can’t really fly a helicopter despite his military record.And she said Princess Diana would disapprove of her own sons lavish wedding - while calling for the National Anthem to be scrapped, and comparing the royals to the Kardashians.The tirade comes just days after the Duchess of Sussex launched a new initiative to help victims of the Grenfell Tower disaster who live in the MP’s constituency.Speaking at the Labour conference in Liverpool, Ms Dent Coad also:The Corbynista MP laid in to the royal family at a fringe meeting hosted by pressure group Labour For A Republic.She claimed the Grenfell “atrocity” has turned the public against the status quo by exposing inequality across the UK.Ms Dent Coad then said: “I know some people find it really encouraging when members of the royal family support local charities - people have told me ‘So and so came in, they helped us with this, and it was really encouraging.’“I don’t have any problem with that at all, but when the cameras are gone let’s remember those volunteers are back doing 99 per cent of the work completely unsung, completely unappreciated.“Their support is important to some, not to others, but its peripheral.”Last week Prince Harry’s we Meghan launched a charity cookbook written with the survivors of Grenfell Tower.She took her mum Doria and Harry to meet the women who wrote recipes for the book at an event at Kensington Palace - located in Ms Dent Coad’s constituency.As well as her dig at royal charity work, the MP hit out at the Queen’s tax arrangements.She said: “She pays tax only on one thing which is the income from her grace and favour properties, the properties that she lets out. So she pays tax on that, nothing else, just that.“She doesnt pay tax on anything else. And as we know she also has some money offshore, so thats disappointing.”In fact, the monarch voluntarily pays tax on all her private income whatever its source.Ms Dent Coad has a track record of angry rants at the royal family.At the same event at last year’s Labour conference, she sparked fury by claiming Prince Harry is unable to fly a helicopter.EMMA Dent Coad became Kensington’s first Labour MP at last year’s General Election, winning the seat by just 20 votes.But she is a longstanding opponent of her constituency’s best-known residents - Princes William and Harry, who both live in Kensington Palace with their wives.Ms Dent Coad is such an ardent republican she even held an anti-royal picnic on the day William married Kate in 2011.And since entering Parliament she has continued slagging off the royals in a string of public rants.The Sun revealed at last year’s Labour conference that she accused Harry of being unable to fly a helicopter.Ms Dent Coad claimed that whenever the prince gets in a chopper, “He just sits there going ‘vroom vroom’.”She’s also compared the Middleton family to the Kardashian clan, dubbing the Duchess of Cambridge “Kate Kardashian”.The MP caused offence ahead of Harry and Meghan’s wedding this year by saying Princess Diana would be upset by the public attention paid to the nuptials.And speaking on the day of the ceremony, Ms Dent Coad called for the National Anthem to be scrapped because it’s “jingoistic”.

title: ruins found in israeli wilderness could prove biblical story of exodus in which moses led israelites from slavery experts believe
story: According to the Bible, Moses liberated the Israelites from their Egyptian rulers and led them through the wilderness of Sinai, before they crossed the River Jordan into the promised land of Canaan.Until now no historical basis for the legend was thought to exist and archaeologists generally agreed that the Israelites were in fact native to Canaan – an ancient region covering modern day Israel.Experts are now analysing whether the ruins could be proof of a nomadic people crossing into the ancient land from outside.David Ben-Shlomo, an archaeologist with Ariel University, said: “We have not proved that these camps are from the period of of the early Israelites, but it is possible.“If they are, this might fit the biblical story of the Israelites coming from east of the Jordan River, then crossing the Jordan and entering into the hill country of Israel later.”Archaeologists are now analysing whether the ruins, named Khirbet el Mastarah, are consistent with a newly-arrived nomadic people.Pottery shards from the site have been dated to the early Iron Age, around the time traditionally associated with the Israelite arrival.The ruins themselves, a number of low walls, are believed to be rudimentary stone fencing for animals – consistent with known nomadic practices.According to Ben-Shlomo and his American dig partner, Ralph Hawkins of Averett University, this could explain why pottery shards at the site were found outside – not inside – the stone walls.“The floors of the structures were virtually empty of finds, and thus, we could not date them by conventional archaeological methods,” they said.“In Bedouin settlements, people live in tents made of perishables which are relocated every season, thus artacts would not be associated with stone architecture.“So the structures might have housed animals, rather than people, who lived in tents around them.”The site, five miles north of Jericho, also makes more sense as a nomadic settlement than a permanent one.Temperatures there can easily reach a searing 45C and annual rainfall is as little as 1cm.“The landscape is arid most of the time and even in modern times most of the population here are Bedouins,” said Ben-Shlomo.Furthermore, the site is isolated and is shielded from view by the surrounding hills – perhaps implying a new population in fear of a hostile reception.Archaeologists are working to confirm whether site is as old as they suspect.“Since this area is not densely populated in many periods, this might indicate a new phenomenon like nomads suddenly creating settlements, or a new population.”The archaeologists are also planning to excavate nearby Uja el-Foqa to determine whether it might be linked to Israelite settlement of the region.The work is not without its challenges – archaeologists must look for cultural clues that the site was indeed Israelite.“It is dficult since many aspects of the material culture of dferent groups, say those from east or west of the Jordan River, may be too similar or not indicative enough,” Ben-Shlomo said.

title: happiest places to live britain life satisfaction
story: Brits have been asked to rate their well-being and le satisfaction, with some parts of the country producing happier residents than others.The Office for National Statistics  has upgraded its regular survey of well being by asking residents four questions to determine  they are happy.People were quizzed on how satisfied they are are with their le, to what extent they feel the things they do in their le are worthwhile, how happy did they feel yesterday and how anxious did they feel yesterday?To answer, those in the survey had to give a personal score out of 10.Overall the UK scored 7.7 out of 10 for le satisfaction, 7.8 out of 10 for feeling worthwhile, 7.5 out of 10 for happiness yesterday and 2.9 out of 10 for feeling anxious yesterday.Rushmoor in Hampshire came out as the happiest place to live, with the people living there scoring it 8.34 out of 10.Whereas those living in Fenland in Cambridgeshire are less enthusiastic about their le there, scoring their happiness level at 6.7 out of 10.Copeland in Cumbria is second ranked in the happiest places in the UK, with a score of 8.24 out of 10.But exclusive Kensington and Chelsea, one of the UKs wealthiest areas, scored low and came in as the second unhappiest place to live.Northern Ireland saw the highest average le satisfaction and happiness ratings when compared with Wales, Scotland and England.And people in London reported a lower average sense that things they do in le are worthwhile.It was also found women reported a higher level of anxiety than man.Silvia Manclossi, Head of Quality of Le Team, Office for National Statistics said: “An important part of our work is looking beyond the economic health of the country to how its people are faring and inequalities in society.Today, for the first time, we have identied how factors such as health, access to services, and crime levels may affect how people rate their well-being in dferent parts of the UK.This can help local authorities and other organisations to better understand where services could be targeted to help improve the well-being of people in their area.”He said earlier in the year: There is a growing recognition that how we are doing as a nation is at least as much about people’s well-being as it is about the country’s economic health.Today’s analysis shows the strengths and challenges of dferent age groups in society.These insights can help target services where they are most needed and can have the best impact.

title: jeremy corbyn speech labour party conference 2018
story: The Labour leader insisted his socialist vision for Britain is now the new common sense as he made his party conference speech.He said: We must take our message to every town, city and village. United and ready to win, ready to govern as we were in 1945, 1964 and 1997.“So that when we meet this time next year let it be as a Labour government.”And in a passage aimed directly at Theresa May, he said  the PM doesnt get a good Brexit deal you need to make way for a party that can.Mr Corbyn told supporters Labour is ready to take charge and start the work of rebuilding our ided country in his hour-long party conference speech.But he also admitted the party had been damaged by the failure to drive out anti-Semitism from the ranks of the hard left - appealing to Jewish voters not to abandon Labour.Laying out his hard-left future for Britain, Mr Corbyn:But critics accused him of embarking on an angry rant and said his spending plans would bankrupt the country.And the Tories blasted him for being willing to betray Brexit just so he can grab power for himself.The leader was greeted with chants of Oh Jeremy Corbyn as he walked on stage to lay out his vision for a hard-left future.Mr Corbyn warned well-off Brits will have to show “solidarity” by handing over huge new taxes on property  the party takes power.He vowed to slap a levy on anyone who owns a second home, saying: “Think of it as a solidarity fund.”Mr Corbyn also suggested hed hike taxes on Brits to pay for an increase in the powers of the state.He said: You can’t keep people safe on the cheap.But despite his radical plans to expand the powers of the state, Mr Corbyn claimed Labour’s policies are only “common sense” which are now supported by a majority of voters.He said: “Where the Tories have ided and ruled, we will unite and govern.“We represent the new common sense of our time. And we are ready to deliver on it.“We must speak for the people to whom Theresa May promised so much but has delivered so little.”And he added that Labour is “the new political mainstream” - inviting even Tory politicians to switch sides.He opened his speech with an attack on the free press and vowed to bring in new curbs on the media.The Labour boss also bizarrely claimed that getting a Brexit deal in Brussels would be a piece of cake.Vowing to vote against Theresa Mays deal when it comes to the Commons, he said that his Brexit Secretary Keir Starmer would have more luck in Brussels.Mr Corbyn said: Keir, having got agreement yesterday in this conference hall, getting one in Brussels should be a piece of cake.But the Labour boss was forced to admit that the anti-Semitism crisis over the summer was tough and apologised to Jewish people for tolerating bigotry in the party.In an attempt to move on from the scandal that has engulfed his party for months he told delegates of his visit to a former Nazi concentration camp at Terezin, and claimed he would be an ally for the Jewish community.He said: The row over anti-Semitism has caused immense hurt and anxiety in the Jewish community and great dismay in the Labour Party. But I hope we can work together to draw a line under it.I say this to all in the Jewish community: This party, this movement, will always be implacable campaigners against anti-Semitism and racism in all its forms.We are your ally.And the next Labour government will guarantee whatever support necessary to ensure the security of Jewish community centres and places of worship, as we will for any other community experiencing hateful behaviour and physical attacks.He claimed to want to fight to stamp out anti-Jew hate with every breath I possess.But he didnt give details of how he would scrub out the hate in his own party.And he attempted to make political capital by accusing the Tories of hypocrisy for pointing out the scandal.The veteran leftie got his biggest cheer from vowing to recognise Palestine as a state  he ever became PM.Delegates gave him a standing ovation as he promised to secure land for the Palestinian people.He was also applauded during a passage where he vowed to help end the civil war in Yemen.After months of playing down the evidence that Putin carried out the Salisbury novichok poisoning today he said Russia were clearly responsible.He said: We are entering a new fast-changing and more dangerous world including the reckless attacks in Salisbury - which the evidence painstakingly assembled by the police now points clearly to the Russian state.Responding to the speech this afternoon, Tory chairman Brandon Lewis said: Jeremy Corbyn has shown at every turn he is unfit to govern.“All he offers are failed ideas that didn’t work in the past and would leave working families paying the price with higher taxes, more debt and more waste – just like last time.“He confirmed Labour are opening the door to re-running the referendum, which would take us all back to square one.“And he didn’t even apologise to Jewish people for his total failure to tackle the anti-Jewish racism that is re in the Labour Party.John OConnell of the Taxpayers Alliance added: Corbyns angry rant offered nothing to the hard-pressed, silent majority of taxpayers who want to be trusted to spend their own money and care for their children as they see fit - without being clobbered by even more cruel punishment taxes.And Adam Marshall of the British Chambers of Commerce said: Jeremy Corbyn missed a golden opportunity to extend an olive branch to British business, big and small alike.Mr Corbyn used his speech to hit out at the “greed is good” attitude which he claims has dominated Britain.He said: “Ten years ago this month, the whole edice of greed-is-good, deregulated financial capitalism, lauded for a generation as the only way to run a modern economy, came crashing to earth, with devastating consequences.”But instead of making essential changes to a broken economic system, the political and corporate establishment strained every sinew to bail out and prop up the system that led to the crash in the first place.“People in this country know - they showed that in June last year - that the old way of running things isn’t working any more.Thats why Labour is offering a radical plan to rebuild and transform Britain.And he promised a future Labour government would create 400,000 “green jobs” by carpeting the country in windfarms and solar panels.Mr Corbyn’s speech in Liverpool came after a conference dominated by bust-ups over Brexit and anti-Semitism.The party unveiled a new policy fudge which could see Labour backing a second EU referendum without the option to cancel Brexit altogether.But senior figures clashed in public over the issue - as Shadow Brexit Secretary Keir Starmer told delegates that Remain should be on the ballot paper in any second referendum.John McDonnell and Emily Thornberry both warned it would be anti-democratic to ignore the result of the 2016 vote.And Corbynista activists brought embarrassment on the party by repeatedly trying to play down the seriousness of Labour’s anti-Semitism crisis.Some hardcore lefties claimed the scandal has been whipped up by Mr Corbyn’s enemies in a bid to discredit his leadership.

title: theresa may chequers plan eu cracking
story: Dferences are finally emerging among the 27 other leaders who have been unied until now, the PM told her top table on Monday as she implored them to “hold our nerve”.And she believes the UK can exploit them to win goods-only access to the single market.In a bid to cheer up her Cabinet during her update to them on last week’s disastrous Salzburg summit, the PM told them: “Some heads of government want to be more constructive than the commission”.But pinning the UKs hopes on an uprising by Scandinavian and Eastern states along with the Netherlands and Belgium against France and Germany’s axis with the EU Commission is seen as very high risk by senior ministers.Despite rumblings from smaller states such as Hungary, a revolt failed to materialise at in the Austria town when leaders unanimously agreed to crush Mrs May’s Chequers plan.A Cabinet source: “The noises coming from the member states themselves are certainly better than what’s coming out of the commission.“But it’s a far cry to then say we’ll be able to win them all over.“Theresa is doubling up on where she already is and it’s looking like a huge bet now.”The development came as senior hardline Tory Brexiteers also turned up the pressure on Mrs May to dump her Chequers plan.A senior figure in the European Research Group revealed all of its 8 odd members are ready to vote down her plan in Parliament.Former minister Mark Francois told BBC Radio 4’s World At One programme: If push really comes to shove, and they try and push Chequers through the House of Commons, then I and my colleagues will vote against it”.A senior EU diplomat also last night told The Sun that Mrs May would not get EU leaders to budge and accept her bid for goods only access to the single market.The diplomat said: They don’t believe us on the Single Market. They think it’s b****ks.“They don’t understand the argument that  we give too much flexibility the whole thing will fall apart because everyone will want an a la carte deal. We’ve said this over and over again but they don’t want to hear it.German Chancellor Angela Merkel said yesterday that a Brexit deal “might already be achievable in October, but only  the UK makes some big decisions. Ms Merkel warned: “Playing for time, I believe, also doesn’t help the business community, because the business community needs clarity.“We have six to eight weeks of very hard work ahead of us in which we have to take the political decisions. A lot depends on what Britain really wants”She added the UK can’t belong to one part of the Single Market but “not to the other three”.  Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: british girls overtake boys worst binge drinkers europe
story: A World Health Organisation study put teenage girls in England, Scotland and Wales in three of the top six places across the continent.The  reports young girls in the UK are more likely than teen boys to get drunk at least twice, with experts claiming it may be caused by anxiety.The research, carried out by St Andrew University for the World Health Organisation, compared the drinking habits of 15-year-olds around Europe between 2002 and 2014.In most nations – including the UK – the proportion of teens drunk on at least two occasions had fallen.Teens in Denmark were the most likely to have been drunk at least twice followed by Welsh girls the youngsters from Hungary, Scotland, Lithuania and England.In those six nations, around a third of the girls had been drunk repeatedly - about twice the rate in Italy and France.Dr Jo Inchley, the assistant director of child and adolescent health research at St Andrews, said: “In some ways it is surprising, as girls tend to respond more to health messages than boys.“We do know mental health is a big concern among girls, and coping could be one of the reasons why girls binge drink.”

title: general strike is not labour
story: NewsGeneral strike 'is not Labour policy' insists party's business chief after MP calls for first one since 1926Crewe MP Laura Smith suggested a nationwide walkout to help topple the Tory Government  Theresa May refuses to call an electionShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByMikey SmithPolitical reporter11:11, 26 SEP 2018NewsCrewe MP Laura Smith"Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailLabour insist a nationwide general strike is not party policy, after an MP called for one Crewe MP Laura Smith suggested a nationwide walkout to help topple the Tory Government  Theresa May refuses to call an election.  She was speaking at The World Transformed festival, which is running alongside Labour Party Conference in Liverpool.  But Shadow Business Secretary Rebecca Long Bailey insisted it was not party policy. She said: Well that's not our position. Laura is an absolutely amazing MP, she's one of the North West MPs with myself, she's so full of energy and enthusiasm, but we're certainly not advocating general strikes as Labour Party policy.  She added: Just to make it perfectly clear a general strike is not Labour Party policy. Labour deputy leader Tom Watson said he thought Ms Smith got a little bit carried away with her general strike comments. He told BBC Radio 4's Today programme: Well, it's not particularly helpful, but she is a new MP and she was at a big fringe event - nothing to do with the party organisation - and I'm sure she got a little bit carried away.  Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn and his top team have stated their aim of securing a general election throughout the conference, which has been dominated by Brexit and the issue of a second referendum.   On Tuesday, the Prime Minister said it would not be in the national interest to hold a general election before Brexit day on March 29. Ms Smith, who is a member of the Unite and Unison unions and a former teacher, raised suggestion of a general strike at The World Transformed festival on Tuesday night. Today we've heard calls for a true people's vote. A general election, the MP for Crewe and Nantwich said. Comrades, we must topple this cruel and callous Tory Government as soon as we can. And  we can't get a general election, we should organise with our brothers and sisters in the trade unions to bring an end to this government with a general strike.

title: jeremy corbyn came mirrors legendary
story: NewsJeremy Corbyn came to the Mirror's legendary Labour conference party - and there's just one thing he wouldn't doThe Labour leader thanked the Mirror at the annual bash at the climax of Party Conference in LiverpoolShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByMikey SmithPolitical reporter11:55, 26 SEP 2018Updated12:23, 26 SEP 2018Newsthis.style.display='none'"/Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror/news/politics/video/jeremy-corbyn-john-mcdonnell-mirrors-13310972,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-M3TH25P,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,bundledCss:false,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx/rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail/F/QVgi9PbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_/,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,bundledCss:false,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx/rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail/F/QVgi9PbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_/,nativeAppBanner:true""Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA nation wept last night - as Jeremy Corbyn flat out refused to dance at the Mirror's legendary Labour conference party. Crowds chanted “Oh Jeremy Corbyn ” as our live house band played along when the Labour leader visited the bash, held at Liverpool's Revolucion De Cuba, marking the climax of the party’s annual conference. But sadly, he wasn't up for a boogie - immediately declaring emphatically with a smile: I am NOT going to dance!  As boos rang out in the bar, he joked: Well, that's a sign of unity, isn't it? Thanks a lot. He thanked the Mirror and the GMB union, who sponsored the party. He said: I look forward to the Mirror making demands of a Labour government of what we can achieve in this country.  He added: I want to say thank you to the Mirror for the social campaigns you've undertaken, the fantastic Pride of Britain awards they put on every year, and being that voice that's prepared to give us a fair hearing. I'm not asking for agreement on everything. I'm not asking for approval. But just give us a fair hearing - plenty of the others don't.  Also at the legendary annual bash - the biggest party of Labour Party Conference - were John McDonnell, and Diane Abbott. While Corbyn didn't dance, plenty of Labour MPs were spotted tearing up the dancefloor.

title: jeremy corbyn says accepts evidence
story: NewsJeremy Corbyn says he accepts that the evidence "clearly suggests" Russia was behind Salisbury attackThe Labour Leader was criticised after the attack when he seemed to question the evidence presented by police and the security services.Share&nbsp&nbspCommentsByOliver Milne14:02, 26 SEP 2018Updated14:09, 26 SEP 2018NewsThe Labour leader said he that the evidence now pointed squarely at Russian involvement "Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email Jeremy Corbyn has said he now accepts that Russia was behind the nerve agent attack in Salisbury. He added: We are entering a new fast-changing and more dangerous world including the reckless attacks in Salisbury, which the evidence painstakingly assembled by the police now points clearly to the Russian state. It later emerged they were poisoned with a military-grade nerve agent developed by the USSR called Novichok .  Two agents from Russia's military intelligence organisation, the GRU, have been charged with conspiracy to murder.

story: NewsMass emergency response sparked after teenagers spray PERFUME in busy ice cream parlourThe group left customers at the Italian Gelato Co in Manchester city centre coughing from the sprayShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByCharlotte CoxPete Bainbridge11:17, 26 SEP 2018NewsCustomers were coughing and feared the gas was deadly "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA huge emergency response was sparked by a group of teenagers who sprayed a substance which later turned out to be perfume around a busy ice cream parlour. Police, specialist firefighters and paramedics were all called to the cafe on Portland Street in Piccadilly on Tuesday evening. Initial reports came in as 'gas being set off' so a 'considerable police response' was scrambled, a GMP spokesman said. A fire service spokesman confirmed that several teams were sent to the scene shortly after 7pm, initially to reports of a possible ‘hazardous material’.   Two crews from Manchester Central, two from Bury, one from Moss Side, one from Hyde, and a specialist unit were all sent to the ice cream parlour. The shop was evacuated and specialist officers carried out a survey of the restaurant, the Manchester Evening News reports.  It was later found that the substance was not dangerous and police confirmed it was perfume. Izzy Baig, owner of the cafe, got a call from her manager after the incident to explain what had happened. She told the M.E.N: We had three teenagers and they sprayed some kind of gas, or liquid, into the restaurant. Everyone started coughing and we had to evacuate the store and call police. In the end, it was some kind of perfume, but because of the smell everyone started coughing. They  had started being silly and spraying it on each other. If they had sprayed it and stayed where they were it would have been fine, but they ran outside which caused the alarm. story: NewsMeghan Markle and Kate Middleton CAN be arrested  they break the law - but there are some royal loopholesEver wondered what would happen  a member of the royal family committed a major crime?Share&nbsp&nbspCommentsByCourtney PochinAudience Writer14:13, 26 SEP 2018NewsWhat would happen  they committed a crime? "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email To quote The Princess Bride, it's inconceivable to think of a member of the royal family breaking the law.   The closest we can picture any of them coming to committing a crime is Prince Harry recently swiping some extra samosas from the launch of the Grenfell charity cookbook.  But what would happen  any of them were actually to do something illegal - would they be arrested or would they get away with it simply because of who they are? Here's everything you need to know...   After marrying in to the most famous family in the country, Meghan Markle and Kate Middleton inherited many fabulous perks - from dazzling tiaras to household chefs and drivers.   However there is one royal perk that by far outweighs the rest and that is Sovereign Immunity - but only The Queen has it.  This is a law which states that the sovereign cannot commit a legal wrong and is thus immune from civil suit or criminal prosecution.  Therefore The Queen is completely above the law, she can quite literally do no wrong. But according to the royal family's website, she still likes to make sure she remains on the straight and narrow: Although civil and criminal proceedings cannot be taken against the Sovereign as a person under UK law, The Queen is careful to ensure that all her activities in her personal capacity are carried out in strict accordance with the law. Unfortunately for other members of the royal household, this blanket immunity does not apply to anyone else.  So for the likes of Prince Charles , Prince William , Prince Harry , Kate Middleton and Meghan Markle, there is a price to be paid for committing a crime.   Of course, being royalty, when it comes to their punishment there are a few loopholes. According to the legal encyclopedia Halsbury's Laws of England, members of the royal household cannot be arrested in civil proceedings, arrests can't take place in the monarch's presence and they also cannot be arrested anywhere near a palace. One royal has already been given a criminal conviction.

story: NewsMum on easyJet flight told by staff to stop breastfeeding mid way through nursing sonKelly Edgson-Payne has flown with son Lex 16 times in the last year and has never had this problem beforeShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsBySarah Lumley12:25, 26 SEP 2018Updated12:48, 26 SEP 2018NewsKelly Edgson-Payne and her son Lex "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA furious mum-of-four has slammed easyJet after she was made to stop breastfeeding her baby during a flight and had to pry the infant off her mid-feed. Kelly Edgson-Payne was mortied and in tears when a male member of cabin crew told her she could not feed her one-year-old son Lex during take-off. The 36-year-old was flying from London Gatwick to Fuerteventura, Spain, on August 20, with her husband Ross, 40, and four children, when the unpleasant incident happened. Kelly, from Rochester, Kent, said: It's just absolutely crazy that I was told that I couldn't feed him - crazy, and really embarrassing for me.  Kelly - who says she has never had an issue breastfeeding any of her children on flights - has now hit out at easyJet for not seeming to know the law about breastfeeding. I find it really disappointing that an airline I trust, and who we fly with all the time, actually broke the law in discriminating against me as a breastfeeding mother, she said. The law in the UK says it protects breastfeeding mothers - and even easyJet's own website says mothers are welcome to breastfeed at any time during a flight. There's just no consistency in their messages. They should not be discriminating against breastfeeding.  When the sports therapist raised the issue with easyJet Customer Services, she was told she was welcome to breastfeed her baby on their flights - as long as you are discreet. She added: We fly with easyJet literally all the time, and I have always breastfed all my children over the years during take-off - because their ears pop and its uncomfortable for them. Most other cabin crew would actually encourage breastfeeding during take-off, because it distracts them and stops them from crying. I've never before been told that I can't feed Lex, or any of my other children - and we've flown with him about 16 times in the last year. So I got settled into my seat and I started to feed my son, as I would usually. Then a male member of cabin crew came over and told me I couldn't feed him during take-off, and that I'd have to stop and strap him in to his infant seat next to me. Kelly continued: It was just crazy. I said, 'Well, he's feeding'. But I just had to stop mid-feed and hand him to my husband.  I was mortied. I'm not afraid to breastfeed my baby wherever - I've stopped at a break point during a marathon before and fed him - but this left me embarrassed and in tears. I had to very quickly cover myself up - but my breasts were still leaking milk, because I had stopped mid-feed. Even my eldest daughter, who is nine, said, 'Mummy, they can't tell you not to breastfeed him'. Kelly, mum to Mia, nine, Elena, five, Jax, three, and Lex, one, said a female member of cabin crew later approached her after take-off and apologised for the incident. She said: The two of them had a bit of a hoo-ha, and she then later came up to me and said, 'I'm sorry about that, ignore him, he's wrong.' What annoys and disappoints me is that there is no consistency. On their website they state, 'We support breastfeeding mothers and you can feed your baby on board at any time'. But when I emailed their customer services about it afterwards, I was told, 'Passengers are allowed to breastfeed their babies on board the aircraft, as long as you are doing this in a discreet manner'.  The ironic thing is, since having my third and fourth children, whenever I fly I have always booked my infant a seat next to me. So I've never in the last six years sat next to a random passenger. Up until the cabin crew told me I couldn't breastfeed, I don't think any other passengers were even paying any attention to me at all. Kelly added that all easyJet offered her in the way of compensation was a &pound25 voucher to be used on another flight with them. She said: I just want them to make themselves aware of the law so no other mums have to go through this.

New research names the police forces that handed out the most tickets and the 10 most active speed cameras, with eight of them located in one constabulary alone. The research from price comparison website GoCompare found that Avon and Somerset recorded more speeding offences than any other region between June 2016 and May 2018. story: NewsWoman 'drops 10 stone through gastric op but nearly dies of sepsis just weeks later'Laura Battrum was obese, weighing 22 stone, when she decided weight loss surgery was her only option after exhausting all dietsShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByJess Grieveson-SmithChris kitching09:37, 26 SEP 2018Updated10:35, 26 SEP 2018NewsLaura Battrum, 35, with a photo of what she looked like before surgery "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email A woman who dropped 10 stone after undergoing a gastric sleeve operation claims she wound up contracting sepsis and nearly died.  Laura Battrum, 35, was obese, weighing 22 stone, when she decided weight loss surgery was her only option after exhausting all diets.  She was thrilled that her dream of starting a family with partner, Steve, 37, was one step closer after the NHS agreed to pay for the operation.  But just weeks after the operation last January, Laura claims she had to be rushed to hospital where she was left fighting for her le.   She claims she developed a deadly blood infection known as sepsis and was rushed into Queen Elizabeth Hospital in Birmingham.  Laura, from Kings Heath, said she was given three days to live as her condition worsened and she spent four weeks in an induced coma. After four months in hospital, Laura was finally allowed home to recover, she added. Laura said she has since battled a number of health problems and has hired lawyers from Irwin Mitchell to investigate her care at Queen Elizabeth Hospital, Birmingham.  She had the initial surgery at a dferent NHS hospital. Laura, a health and social assessor who now weighs nine stone, said: I had been overweight my entire le and would binge on food most days. I tried diet pills, countless diets and exercise but nothing worked. I needed to lose weight  I wanted to become a mum one day so I decided to research weight loss surgery. After opting for the gastric sleeve I was booked in for the surgery on January 3.  I was then discharged from hospital but over the next coming weeks I began to feel unwell and was unbeknownst to me, battling sepsis. I'd developed a rash at first, then diarrhoea and shortness of breath. I saw medical professionals within those weeks and sepsis was not picked up. I sought medical attention, however, it wasn't until January 29, when Steve called for an ambulance while I was in and out of consciousness that I was diagnosed with sepsis. The following day I was placed into an induced coma and wasn't awoken until February 27. She said she now has a stoma and still continues to suffer with mobility problems and fatigue. Laura said: For several weeks I was in more and more pain. It got to the point when the pain got so bad Steve called for an ambulance and that is the last thing I really remember.  The seriousness of my condition only hit home when, after coming round from my coma, the doctors said it was touch and go whether I was going to pull through. I did not really know much about sepsis and how dangerous it can be before I fell ill. But following my surgery I developed sepsis and was left fighting for my le. I was terried I would never wake up and I was in a coma for four weeks battling the infection. I only wanted to lose weight but I almost lost my le. I underwent emergency surgery for a perforated bowel and a further six operations in an attempt to finally beat the sepsis. My health problems have been an ongoing war with the stoma and mobility issues still causing problems, but I'm now trying to raise awareness of what is referred to as the silent killer.

story: NewsBaby crawling across main road saved by motorist who who nearly hit himHero driver Cory Cannon blocked the 40mph road after seeing the 10-month-old infant on all fours crossing the road in New JerseyShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByLaura Elvin11:39, 26 SEP 2018NewsThe shocking image shows a 10-month-old baby crawling across the road after escaping from his home "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA shocking image shows a ten-month-old baby crawling across a busy road in a sight that will strike terror into all parents. The 41-year-old driver swerved across the road after seeing the child, who he initially mistook for a plastic toy. Three men accused of murdering Brit millionaire and his Thai we taken to makesht grave by police  The investigator believes he was alone in the engine room since it was 3am and the encounters were so strong they sent shivers down his spine and left him dizzy and nauseous. Xavier had heard stories of hauntings by two ghosts known as John and Harry who he says both died in the engine room, and also a little girl named Jackie who allegedly drowned in the second class pool. He believes the singing voice in his video to be the 'ghost girl' Jackie - and even claims he is one of the lucky few to make contact with the ghost. Xavier said: The moments before hearing the little ghost girl sing was actually one of the best experiences I've ever had as an investigator. story: NewsTruth behind man shouting into bored woman's ear in 'most relatable nightclub photo in history'The picture has been shared all over the world - and people are imagining what he's sayingShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByNicola OakleyHead of Audience12:27, 26 SEP 2018Updated14:10, 26 SEP 2018News "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA photograph of a man shouting into a woman's ear in the middle of a nightclub has gone viral after being dubbed 'the most relatable nightclub photo in history'. title: bible story exodus could true
story: NewsBible story of Exodus 'could be true' as archaeologists discover 'ancient' ruins near River JordanExperts are analysing whether ruins are proof of a nomadic Israelite people crossing into the ancient land from outsideShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByMichael Havis14:11, 26 SEP 2018NewsArchaeologists are analysing whether the ruins, named Khirbet el Mastarah, are consistent with a newly-arrived nomadic people "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailArchaeologists have discovered 'ancient' ruins near the River Jordan in what could be the first ever evidence of the Biblical story of Exodus, it is claimed. In the Bible, Moses is said to have liberated the Israelites from slavery in Egypt and led them through the wilderness of Sinai, before they crossed the River Jordan into the promised land of Canaan. However, no historical basis for the account exists and archaeologists generally agree that the Israelites were, in fact, native to Canaan - an ancient region covering modern day Israel. But now, experts are analysing whether ruins near the river are proof of a nomadic Israelite people crossing into the ancient land from outside. Some claim it could be the first ever evidence of the Biblical account.  We have not proved that these camps are from the period of of the early Israelites, but it is possible, said David Ben-Shlomo, an archaeologist with Ariel University. If they are, this might fit the biblical story of the Israelites coming from east of the Jordan River, then crossing the Jordan and entering into the hill country of Israel later. Archaeologists are analysing whether the ruins, named Khirbet el Mastarah, are consistent with a newly-arrived nomadic people. Pottery shards from the site have been dated to the early Iron Age, around the time traditionally associated with the Israelite arrival. Meanwhile, the ruins themselves, a number of low walls, are believed to be rudimentary stone fencing for animals - consistent with known nomadic practices.  According to Dr Ben-Shlomo and his American dig partner, Ralph Hawkins of Averett University, this could explain why pottery shards at the site were found outside - not inside - the stone walls. The floors of the structures were virtually empty of finds, and thus, we could not date them by conventional archaeological methods, they said. In Bedouin settlements, people live in tents made of perishables which are relocated every season, thus artacts would not be associated with stone architecture. So the structures might have housed animals, rather than people, who lived in tents around them. The site, five miles north of Jericho, is also said to make more sense as a nomadic settlement than a permanent one. Temperatures there can easily reach a searing 45C, while annual rainfall is as little as 1cm.  The landscape is arid most of the time and even in modern times most of the population here are Bedouins, said Dr Ben-Shlomo. Furthermore, the site is isolated and is shielded from view by the surrounding hills - perhaps implying a new population in fear of a hostile reception. Now, the archaeologists are working to confirm whether site is as old as they suspect. Dr Ben-Shlomo said: Sites like Khirbet el Mastarah and other similar ones in the Jordan Valley seem - at least from survey material - to appear suddenly during the Iron Age. Since this area is not densely populated in many periods, this might indicate a new phenomenon like nomads suddenly creating settlements, or a new population.  Soil samples from Khirbet el Mastarah have now been sent for analysis. Samples from beneath the walls will be tested for a build-up of electrons, which get trapped over the years and are only released by light radiation. They could reveal the age of the structure, it is claimed. Meanwhile, samples from between the walls will be tested for elevated levels of phosphorus, which would be consistent with animal dung accruing in them. Results are expected in a few months. The archaeologists are also planning to excavate nearby Uja el-Foqa to determine whether it might be linked to Israelite settlement of the region. However the work is not without its challenges - archaeologists must look for cultural clues that the site was indeed Israelite. It is dficult since many aspects of the material culture of dferent groups  may be too similar or not indicative enough, said Dr Ben-Shlomo.

title: brit sleeps russian airport two
story: NewsBrit sleeps in Russian airport for TWO WEEKS after he's barred from flying back to UKSteve Beard, who moved to Siberia after falling in love with a Russian woman on a dating website, had no cash or bank card and was forced to sleep in a chair in the waiting room until he was saved by a strangerShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByWill Stewart11:54, 26 SEP 2018Updated12:08, 26 SEP 2018NewsBritish pensioner Steve Beard was stranded without any cash or a bank card "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA penniless British pensioner was forced to sleep rough in a Russian airport terminal for two weeks after being barred from leaving the country. Steve Beard had moved to a village in Siberia after falling in love a decade ago with schoolteacher-turned-businesswoman Ruslana Lesyuta, then 42, on a dating website. The Brit was planning to fly back to the UK to arrange for his pension payments to reach him in remote Irkutsk, where temperatures plummet to minus 50C or below in winter. But when the dad flew to Moscow he was barred from leaving Russia because his residency permit had expired - and his plight has been compared to the plot in the Hollywood film The Terminal.  Steve, who has an eight-year-old son named Robert, told the Komsomolskaya Pravda newspaper: “They stopped me and did not let me fly out of the country. I was fined. “And the migration service urged me to  to Irkutsk.” Instead, Steve, who worked for 30 years in a London metals plant, flew to Pulkovo airport in St Petersburg to try and leave Russia there. But again he was forbidden to pass immigration and fly to his homeland.   In despair, he stayed in the terminal without any cash or a bank money, Komsomolskaya Pravda reported:  It was only due to help from a Russian tourism official, who felt his plight was like the character played by Tom Hanks in 2004 film The Terminal, that he was rescued from his ordeal. Steve said: “I slept in an chair in the waiting room. I washed my face and hair in the restrooms. I ate the cheapest food at airport diners. “I do not speak Russian, so I could not earn any money here.”  He pleaded from help from the British consulate and was lucky to find a sympathetic friend in the St Petersburg tourist information bureau. Ilya Tarashkevich said: “Steve approached me and asked how a foreigner can receive a money transfer. He did not have a card, and the bank did not work with foreigners. “My colleagues and I were puzzled. Soon I realised that the only way was to use my card.” He took pity on a man labelled an “alien” who “had not eaten for three days”.  Ilya said: “I thought what should happen in a person's le to make this happen. “Then Beard also said that he was afraid that he would be banned from entering the country again . “The most important thing in his le is his child. I am a father myself, so I understand him. “Then I decided to help Steve.” The consulate needed scans of all his documents. Ilya said: “There are no copy centres at the airport so I ran around the offices of cellular operators and asked: 'Do you remember the movie Terminal? I have a person here with the same story. Help me to scan the documents'.”  This led to a court appearance where Steve was fined 5,000 roubles - around &pound58 - but the judge understood his plight and overruled a demand to have him expelled from Russia after he had paid his fine. Expulsion - which could bar him ing in the near future - would violate the human right to a family le, the court ruled. Specically the judge decided that his son’s rights to be with his father were more important than expelling him for failing to renew his residence permit on time. Steve is now preparing new documents allowing him to reenter Russia after he s from his trip to Britain.

story: NewsWoman, 25, has huge 5ft iPhone headstone over burial plot with picture of her as 'screensaver'One cemetery visitor thought he was "having hallucinations" when he saw the gravestone for Rita ShameevaShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByWill Stewart08:12, 26 SEP 2018Updated08:14, 26 SEP 2018NewsRita's iPhone headstone "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA 25-year-old woman has been buried underneath a massive iPhone headstone - leaving mourners stunned. It was erected by her grieving father Rais Shameev long after his daughter's death in January 2016 from an unknown cause, say reports. He has not commented on the unusual memorial. Mourner Nikolay Yevdokimov told newspaper ProUral: “I thought I was having hallucinations. “How could an American smartphone suddenly appear at our cemetery? “And such a huge one.  “I came closer and was surprised. “I've seen many gravestones, but to make one in the form of iPhone - this is the first time, to be honest. “It was made for a young woman from black basalt most likely.
